modelIdentification.name: NETN-SE
modelIdentification.purpose: Define synthetic environment objects in a HLA Federation Execution.
modelIdentification.description:
New definitions of Geo Objects, does not depend on RPR_v2 SE-FOM.
A NETN_Facility object class to define facilities for different services.

poc.pocName: MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation

modelIdentification.other:

You are NOT allowed to modify the NETN FOM Module or its documentation without prior permission by the NATO Modelling and Simulation Group.

objectClass.name: SE_GeoObject
objectClass.semantics: Representation of geographically associated locations, paths, and regions with or without a defined name. E.g. a harbour may be represented as a Location with a specific name, a commonly used route can be represented as a named path and a region can be represented as an specific geographic are and reused as an object instance in the simulation.

attribute.name: UniqueId
attribute.semantics: Required: Unique identifier for the GeoObject.

attribute.name: Name
attribute.semantics: Optional: Name of the GeoObject, e.g. Location name, Road name etc.

objectClass.name: Location
objectClass.semantics: A geographical point in lat, lon and altitude above mean sea level.

attribute.name: Point
attribute.semantics: Required. A geographical point in lat, lon and altitude above mean sea level.

objectClass.name: Path
objectClass.semantics: Definies a path object with a least two locations.

attribute.name: Points
attribute.semantics: Required. A path with at least 2 points expressed as GeodeticPoints.

objectClass.name: Region
objectClass.semantics: Required. A surface defined by at least three points in a ploygon or a circle.

attribute.name: Area
attribute.semantics: Required. Defines the area, either as a geodetic polygon, circle or quadrangle.

objectClass.name: SE_Facility
objectClass.semantics: Base class for NETN Syntetic Environment object classes.

attribute.name: UniqueId
attribute.semantics: Required. Pre-defined or generated unique identifier of the object instance.

attribute.name: LocationReference
attribute.semantics: Required. A reference that identifies a geographical location directly or indirectly by reference to simulated object.

attribute.name: SymbolId
attribute.semantics: Optional. A symbol identifier represented as a string. The symbol standard used is indicated using an URI notation (uri:xxxxxxxxxx). The following uri should be used for common symbology standards app6b, app6b, app6c, app6c, 2525b, 2525c, 2525d. If not provided the symbol standard used is undefined.

attribute.name: Status
attribute.semantics: Optional. Specifies if the facility is active (operational) or not. Default value is 1 (Active).

attribute.name: ObjectType
attribute.semantics: Optional. Specifying the domain, the kind and the specific identification of the environment object.

attribute.name: ForceId
attribute.semantics: Optional. The force that operates the Facility. Default is 0 (Other).

attribute.name: PercentComplete
attribute.semantics: Optional. Describes the level of completness during establishment/building of facility expressed in percent [0-100]. Default is 100%.

attribute.name: DamageState
attribute.semantics: Optional. The damage state on the Facility. Default value is 0 (NoDamage).

objectClass.name: CheckPoint
objectClass.semantics: A checkpoint defines a location where simulated aggregate and physical entities should stop and wait a specified time before continuing on their route. If the checkpoint is currently in operation the status attribute should be set to true. A system simulating movement of physical or aggregate entities can be either directly affected by the checkpoint by subscribing to its state or indirectly by receiving an NETN-ETR `Wait` task.

attribute.name: DelayTime
attribute.semantics: Required. The time that an entity shall wait at the checkpoint before passing. This is a nominal value, federates can use this for modifing delay time for different types if entities, e.g add or subtract a value or multiply with a type depending factor.

variantRecordData.name: GeoLocationReferenceVariant

alternative.name: GeodeticLocation
alternative.semantics: A location on the surface of the earth defined by lat, lon WGS84.

alternative.name: GeodeticCircle
alternative.semantics: A geodetic point and radius specifying a circle on the surface of the earth WGS84 where the radius is a great circle distance on the surface.

alternative.name: GeodeticQuadrangle
alternative.semantics: A latitude-longitude quadrangle is a region bounded by two meridians and two parallels.

alternative.name: GeodeticPolygon
alternative.semantics: A polygon on the surface of the earth defined by a number of great-circle arcs represented as lat, lon Locations. WGS84.

alternative.name: NETNGeoObjectReference
alternative.semantics: Reference to an object instance of class Location, Path or Region, defined in NETN-SE FOM Module or a NETN Physical or Aggregate entity with UUID.

alternative.name: RPREntityReference
alternative.semantics: Reference to an instance of a leaf node subclass of RPR-FOM BaseEntity by its EntityIdentifier. E.g. an Aircraft, SurfaceVessel etc.

variantRecordData.semantics: The area affected by an Environment Condition can be expressed as: - a location on the earth's surface represented by a Point, - an area on the earth's surface, represented by a Quadrangle, GeodeticPolygon, or GeodeticCircle, or - a reference to some other object/data. Objects that can be referenced are RPR entities, NETN entities, NETN-SE GeoObjects and GML Features.
